required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Follow-up on Children and Adolescents With Type 1 Diabetes Treated With Insulin Detemir. An Extension to Trial NN304-1689
clinical_study.official_title: A 52-Week, Multinational, Multi-Centre, Open-Labelled Extension Trial of Insulin Detemir in Children and Adolescents 3-17 Years With Type 1 Diabetes on a Basal-Bolus Regimen With Insulin Aspart as Bolus Insulin

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is conducted in Europe. The aim of this research is to assess the safety of continuous treatment with insulin detemir following participation in trial NN304-1689 (NCT00435019) on antibody development.

primary_outcome.description: Estimated amount of bound antibodies in percent of total antibodies. The primary analysis of cross-reacting antibodies included results from blood samples taken before insulin detemir and less than 3 hours after insulin aspart injection. In addition, an analysis was done including results from samples taken before insulin detemir and less than 2.5 hours after insulin aspart injection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Development of Insulin Detemir Specific Antibodies and Insulin Aspart Specific Antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: Amount of Insulin Detemir and Insulin Aspart specific antibodies in percent of total antibodies after 0, 52 and 104 weeks.
Glycosylated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) measured after 104 weeks.
FPG (Fasting Plasma Glucose) values after 104 weeks.

Mild: signs/symptoms but able to treat him/herself. Moderate: signs/symptoms not able to treat him/herself. Responds to oral treatment. Severe: signs/symptoms and unable to treat him/herself. semiconscious/unconscious/in coma +/- convulsion and may require parenteral treatment.

Standard deviation-score (SD-score) after 104 weeks. The SD-score for weight was calculated based on a British reference population from 1990. To estimate the growth of children, standardised mean weight values were calculated for each month of age and for each sex. Thus, a child with a weight equal to the mean value for its age and sex has an SD score of 0, while a child with a weight 2 SDs above the mean value for its age and sex has an SD score of +2.
Daily insulin doses (basal (Insulin Detemir) and bolus (Insulin Aspart)) at week 104.

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory Values: Albumin Serum and Total Protein Serum (g/dL)
secondary_outcome.description: Albumin Serum and Total Protein Serum after 104 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory Values: Sodium Serum, Potassium Serum and Haemoglobin (mmol/L)
secondary_outcome.description: Sodium Serum, Potassium Serum and Haemoglobin after 104 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory Values: Alkaline Phosphatase Serum, Alanine Aminotransferase Serum and Lactate Dehydrogenase Serum (U/L)
secondary_outcome.description: Alkaline phosphatase serum, Alanine Aminotransferase serum and Lactate Dehydrogenase serum after 104 weeks.

Fundoscopy after 104 weeks. Abn. CS = Abnormal, clinically significant Abn. NCS = Abnormal, Not clinically significant Abn. CS = Abnormal, clinically significant Abn. NCS = Abnormal, Not clinically significant
Blood pressure (Systolic and Diastolic) after 104 weeks.

arm_group.description: Insulin detemir up to twice daily plus insulin aspart at larger meals, doses are adjusted individually (treatment up to 104 weeks)

intervention.description: Treat-to-target dose titration scheme (individually adjusted), injection s.c. (under the skin), once or twice daily.
Treat-to target dose titration scheme (individually adjusted), injection s.c. (under the skin), at larger meals.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed Consent obtained before any trial-related activities. (Trial-related activities are any procedure that would not have been performed during normal management of the subject). The parents or legal representative of the subject must sign and date the Informed Consent Form.
- Finalised 52 weeks of treatment with insulin detemir in trial NN304-1689.
- Fertile females (girls who have had their first menstrual period) must use adequate contraception (barrier methods, contraceptive pills or intrauterine device (IUD)) if there is any risk of pregnancy in the opinion of the Investigator. For Denmark and France only contraceptive pills or intrauterine device are considered as adequate contraceptive methods.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant concomitant disease such as endocrine, hepatic, renal, cardiac, respiratory, neurological, gastrointestinal, malignant or pancreatic diseases as judged by the Investigator.
- Pregnant or the intention of becoming pregnant.
- Previous participation in this trial (defined as enrolment).

address.country: Macedonia, The Former Yugoslav Republic of

location_countries.country: Macedonia, The Former Yugoslav Republic of

reference.citation: Thalange N, Bereket A, Jensen LB, Hiort LC, Peterkova V. Development of Insulin Detemir/Insulin Aspart Cross-Reacting Antibodies Following Treatment with Insulin Detemir: 104-week Study in Children and Adolescents with Type 1 Diabetes Aged 2-16 Years. Diabetes Ther. 2016 Dec;7(4):713-724. Epub 2016 Sep 6.

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Insulin degludec, insulin aspart drug combination

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 29 sites in 11 countries: (Bulgaria (3 sites), Czech Republic (3 sites), Denmark (2 sites), Finland (4 sites), France (1 site), Hungary (2 sites), Macedonia (1 site), Poland (4 sites), Russian Federation (4 sites), Turkey (4 sites) and United Kingdom (1 site)
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: At entry subjects had finalised 52-weeks treatment with insulin detemir plus insulin aspart (Trial NN304-1689, NCT00435019). Subjects treated with NPH insulin plus insulin aspart in trial NN304-1689 were not offered to continue in this extension trial. Subjects continued treatment with insulin detemir and insulin aspart doses from trial NN304-1689.

measure.title: Pubertal Status
measure.description: Tanner scale: Pre-pubertal: Tanner grade 1: the vellus over the pubes is not further developed than that over the abdominal wall, i.e. no pubic hair. Pubertal: Tanner grade 2 or more: sparse growth of long slightly pigmented downy hair, straight, or slightly curled, chiefly at base of penis or along labia.

outcome.title: Insulin Detemir-insulin Aspart Cross-reacting Antibodies
outcome.description: Estimated amount of bound antibodies in percent of total antibodies. The primary analysis of cross-reacting antibodies included results from blood samples taken before insulin detemir and less than 3 hours after insulin aspart injection. In addition, an analysis was done including results from samples taken before insulin detemir and less than 2.5 hours after insulin aspart injection.
outcome.population: Full analysis set 146 (100%), safety analysis set 146 (100%) The full analysis set was used for efficacy analyses and included subjects with signed informed consent who had been exposed to trial drug in extension. The safety analysis set included all subjects with a signed informed consent who were exposed in the extension.

outcome.title: SD-score (Z-score) for Body Weight
outcome.description: Standard deviation-score (SD-score) after 104 weeks. The SD-score for weight was calculated based on a British reference population from 1990. To estimate the growth of children, standardised mean weight values were calculated for each month of age and for each sex. Thus, a child with a weight equal to the mean value for its age and sex has an SD score of 0, while a child with a weight 2 SDs above the mean value for its age and sex has an SD score of +2.
outcome.population: The safety analysis set included all subjects with a signed informed consent who were exposed in the extension.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Novo Nordisk reserves the right not to release data until specified milestones, e.g., a Clinical Trial Report is available. At the end of the trial, one or more manuscripts for publication will be prepared in collaboration between authors and Novo Nordisk. Novo Nordisk will not suppress or veto publications; however Novo Nordisk reserves the right to postpone publication and/or communication for a short time to protect intellectual property.
